duties_responsibilities.duty: Prepare patients and rooms for exams and procedures.
Perform basic laboratory testing, point of care testing, phlebotomy, and other quality controls.
Administer medications as directed by physician/nurse practitioner.
Assist physician/nurse practitioner with exams and procedures.
Accurately document medical information in the patient records.
Track and route test results to physician(s)/nurse practitioner(s) for review, and file results in medical records.
Communicate test results with patients when deemed appropriate by physician/nurse practitioner.
Facilitate patient care activities, including scheduling ancillary tests, reinforcing patient education, and performing triage.
Maintain adequate inventory of medical, office, and pharmaceutical supplies.
Demonstrate and maintain professional behavior in accordance with established standards.
Exercise timely, concise, and appropriate use of telephone to meet the needs of external and internal customers.
Perform basic computer skills in using electronic health record proficiently while conducting daily documentation and communications involved in patient care.
Perform other related duties as assigned.

education_certification.credential: Completion of a medical assistant program, or equivalent experience.
For Oregon only: Completion of Basic Oregon Emergency Medical Technician program.
For Oregon only: Completion of Advanced Oregon Emergency Medical Technician program.
